data.text:
BEAVER FALLS

Cyril J. Vandenberg, 82, of Beaver Falls, died Thursday, October 22, 2009, in Heritage Valley Beaver.

Born June 23, 1927, in Steubenville, OH, a son of the late Cyril G. and Anna W. Usselton Vandenberg, he was a veteran of the U.S. Navy serving during the Korean War and Vietnam. He was a member of the First Baptist Church, Beaver Falls.

In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by his wife, Esther L. Sarver Vandenberg, in 2004, and a brother, James Vandenberg.

Surviving are two daughters and a son-in-law, Susan and Ron Stear, Rochester, and Linda Paolucci, Beaver Falls; four sons and two daughters-in-law, Cyril Vandenberg, Reston, VA; Ronald and Bertha Vandenberg, Beaver Falls; Dennis Vandenberg, Dallas, TX, and Kenneth and Amanda Vandenberg, Los Angeles, CA; a brother, Dennis Vandenberg, Phoenix, AZ; two sisters, Marylon Grinder, Washington, and Edith Ours, Ohio; seven grandchildren, Cyril and Cindy Vandenberg, John, Angelo and Antonio Paolucci, and Elizabeth and Bryon Vandenberg; fourteen great-grandchildren, and numerous nieces, nephews, great-nieces and great-nephews.

Friends will be received in the LUTTON BEAVER FALLS FUNERAL HOME, 1117 Fifth Ave., www. luttonfuneralhome.com, Tuesday from noon until the time of service at 2 p.m. with his pastor, the Rev. Steven D. Brotzman, officiating.

Private interment will be in Grandview Cemetery, Big Beaver.

The Beaver County Special Unit will meet at the funeral home at 2:30 pm to present full military honors.
